title: Two arrested for aiding and abetting Jinthupitiya shooting
byline: A male and a female suspect have been arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting the fatal shooting of a person and the injuring of four others inside a barbershop (salon) in the Jinthupitiya area.

title: Bill Clinton to lawmakers investigating Epstein: ‘I saw nothing’
byline: Bill Clinton told lawmakers on Friday that he “saw nothing that gave me pause” when he spent time with Jeffrey Epstein, as the former president gave closed-door testimony about his relationship with the late sex offender.

title: Milan tram derails and slams into a building, killing two people
byline: A tram derailed Friday and slammed into a building in the heart of Milan, killing two people and injuring more than two-dozen others, officials said.

title: Mainly fair weather expected in most parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers are likely at a few places in Kaluthara, Rathnapura, Galle and Matara districts after 2.00 p.m., the Department of Meteorology said.

title: US allows staff to leave Israel as Iran tensions soar
byline: US President Trump has threatened to attack Iran if it doesn’t agree to a new deal on its nuclear program by early March. Meanwhile, the UN’s nuclear watchdog has urged Tehran to allow inspections at its nuclear sites.

title: New shipment of LP gas arrives; stocks to be released to market today - Laugfs
byline: Laugfs Gas PLC has announced that a vessel carrying a new shipment of LP gas arrived in the country today (28).

title: Sri Lanka apparel exports to US, EU fall in January, UK holds steady
byline: According to data released by the Joint Apparel Association Forum (JAAF), total exports during the month reached $425.44m compared with $437.07m in January 2025.

title: 4 arrested with narcotics worth over Rs. 500M, ammunition in Ahungalla and Ambalangoda raids
byline: Four suspects, including a woman, were arrested by police last evening (27) while in possession of a large haul of “Ice” (crystal methamphetamine) and heroin valued at over Rs. 500 million and ammunition.

title: Sanath Jayasuriya to step down as Sri Lanka’s Head Coach?
byline: Sanath Jayasuriya will step down as Head Coach of the Sri Lanka national cricket team following today’s Super Eight match against the Pakistan at the ongoing ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, sources told Ada Derana.

title: Suspect wanted over double murder arrested at BIA upon return from Qatar
byline: A suspect wanted in connection with a double murder committed by shooting has been arrested upon his return to Sri Lanka from overseas.

title: Sri Lankan-born baker wins ‘best traditional baguette’ prize in Paris
byline: Sithamparappillai Jegatheepan, a 43-year-old Sri Lankan-born baker at Fournil Didot in the 14th arrondissement of Paris, has won the Grand Prix for the Parisian Traditional Baguette 2026, a prestigious award presented among 143 competing baguettes.

title: US participating in Israeli strikes against Iran – reports
byline: The United States is participating in the Israeli strikes against Iran, according to a U.S. official and a person familiar with the operation, who spoke on condition of anonymity to detail sensitive military operations.

title: Israel’s defense minister says his country has attacked Iran and declares a state of emergency
byline: Israel launched an attack on Iran on Saturday, with the country’s defense minister declaring a state of emergency across the country.

title: Israel, Iran close airspace for flights after strike on Tehran
byline: Israel and Iran closed their airspace after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government launched “preventive” airstrikes on Tehran.

title: Paramount to buy Warner Bros Discovery in $110 billion deal as Netflix bows out of race
byline: Warner Bros Discovery has agreed to be acquired by Paramount Skydance in a $110 billion deal, ending a high-stakes bidding war after Netflix walked away from its agreement with the HBO Max owner.

title: At least 15 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
byline: At least 15 people have been killed and others injured after a Bolivian air force cargo plane crashed in the western city of El Alto, the country’s authorities say.

title: ‘When we are finished, take over your government’: Trump confirms US strikes on Iran
byline: Donald Trump has confirmed that the US has launched “major combat operations” against Iran in an eight-minute video on Truth Social.

title: Three arrested with narcotic pills worth Rs. 3 million in Panadura
byline: Three persons, including a married couple, have been arrested in connection with the possession of a stock of narcotic pills worth Rs. 3 million, the Panadura South Police Headquarters said.

title: Tenders invited for emergency purchase of 300,000 MT of coal
byline: The Lanka Coal Company (LCC) has invited tenders for the emergency procurement of 300,000 metric tons of coal for the Lakvijaya Coal Power Plant in Norochcholai.

title: Sri Lanka’s ageing population on the rise as youth show declining interest in parenthood: PASL
byline: The Population Association of Sri Lanka (PASL) has raised concerns over the increase in the number of elderly citizens compared to children and youth in the country.

title: Iran launches missiles at Israel, IDF says
byline: The Israel Defence Forces said it has identified missiles launched from Iran towards the State of Israel.

title: Explosions heard in Dubai, Riyadh, Qatar, Kuwait and Bahrain
byline: Reports of multiple explosions are emerging from across the Gulf region, with residents and local media describing loud blasts and air defense activity in several countries as tensions escalate rapidly.

title: SriLankan Airlines expects flight delays amid Middle East airspace closures
byline: SriLankan Airlines says there may be delays in flights to and from Sri Lanka due to the closure of airspace in several Middle Eastern countries following the latest escalation of tensions between Israel and Iran.

title: Netanyahu says joint attack with US was to remove ‘existential threat posed’ by Iran
byline: Benjamin Netanyahu has confirmed Israel and the US have carried out an operation “to remove the existential threat posed by the terrorist regime in Iran”.

title: Nearly 8,000 drug addicted children and youths under 21 arrested in 2024
byline: A total of 7,950 school-going children and youth below the age of 21 have been arrested within the year 2024 over addiction to heroin and ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine), according to Sri Lanka Police.

title: Former army intelligence officer among 4 arrested with drug haul and ammo cache
byline: A former army intelligence officer is among four suspects arrested on Friday (27) in connection with the seizure of a large haul of ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine) and heroin valued at over Rs. 500 million, along with a cache of ammunition, the police said.

title: Missile attack targeted US Navy’s 5th Fleet headquarters in Bahrain – reports
byline: Update: The United Arab Emirates, Qatar and Kuwait have closed their airspace, joining Iran, Iraq and Israel in shutting their skies amid escalating regional tensions following military strikes between Israel and Iran.

title: SriLankan Airlines announcement on cancelled flights
byline: SriLankan Airlines announced that all flights departing to the Middle East from Colombo have been cancelled until 12.00 noon on March 01 (Sunday) due to the ongoing Middle East conflict.

title: Two teens missing after boat capsizes in Lunugamvehera Reservoir
byline: Two teenagers have been reported missing following a boat capsizing incident at the Lunugamvehera Reservoir.

title: Trump warns some Americans may die amid US strikes in Iran
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday that the United States had begun “major combat operations” in Iran, warning that there may be U.S. casualties.

title: Israeli strikes reportedly kill senior Iranian leaders, sources say
byline: Two senior Iranian officials are believed to have been killed in Israeli attacks, sources have told the Reuters news agency.

title: Sri Lankan Embassy in Abu Dhabi issues travel advisory over Middle East tensions
byline: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Abu Dhabi has issued an official notice to all Sri Lankan nationals residing in or visiting the United Arab Emirates, advising them to exercise heightened caution in light of the prevailing tensions across the Middle East.

title: US-Israeli airstrike kills 51 students at Iranian school
byline: At least 51 have been killed in an Israel-US airstrike on a girls’ elementary school in Minab, near Bandar Abbas in the Hormozgan province in southern Iran, state news agency IRNA and other media reported.

title: SriLankan Airlines suspends flights to Middle East; CAASL implements special program to manage flights
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) has stated that a special program is being implemented under the leadership of the Director General of Civil Aviation and Chief Executive Officer, Captain Daminda Rambukwella, to facilitate passengers and aircraft arriving in and departing from Sri Lanka.

title: Foreign Ministry issues security guidelines for Sri Lankans in Middle East
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism of Sri Lanka says it is closely monitoring the rapidly evolving security situation in the Middle East.

title: Iranian FM dismisses reports saying Supreme Leader Khamenei killed
byline: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is still alive “as far as I know,” Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said in an exclusive live interview with NBC News from Tehran, following joint strikes by the United States and Israel.

title: Sri Lanka offers temporary visa extension amid Middle East–bound flight cancellations
byline: In view of the cancellation of Middle East–bound flights effective from 28 February 2026, passengers who are unable to depart Sri Lanka within the validity period of their visas may encounter difficulties, the Controller General of Immigration and Emigration stated.

title: Foreign Ministry sets up 24-hour emergency operations centre amid Middle East tensions
byline: In view of the ongoing tensions in the Middle East, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism says it is closely monitoring the situation of Sri Lankan nationals residing in the affected countries.

title: Fuel prices increased
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today (28).

title: Sri Lanka calls for utmost restraint and immediate de-escalation in Middle East
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka today expressed deep concern over the rapid escalation of hostilities in the Middle East, which it said poses a serious threat to regional stability as well as to international peace and security.
